title: Calories in Baked Chicken Thigh
meta_description: Discover calories in baked chicken thigh, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown per thigh, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Bone-in, skin-on chicken thigh, baked without added oil or seasonings; ~100g edible portion.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by size, skin inclusion, cooking method, and added ingredients. Check labels or use a food scale for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: One baked chicken thigh with skin provides ~229 kcal and ~23 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp olive oil for baking

faqs.q: How many calories in one baked chicken thigh?
faqs.a: About 229 kcal for a skin-on, bone-in thigh (~100g).

faqs.q: What's the protein in baked chicken thigh?
faqs.a: Roughly 23 g protein per skin-on thigh.

faqs.q: Does skin affect calories in baked chicken thigh?
faqs.a: Yes, removing skin cuts ~109 kcal, dropping to ~120 kcal.
Yes, 0 g carbs per thigh under standard preparation.

faqs.q: How does baking vs. frying change calories?
faqs.a: Baking is lower in fat/calories than frying, which adds ~50-100 kcal from oil.
